headline: Lending
pros: Colleagues within the team were great to work with
cons: Feeling that risk is not considered fully

headline: Forced to Review
pros: When it was Capital G Bank, they were the best Bank.  Took care of their staff.
cons: They took away the staff mortgage benefits!

headline: Old Boys Club
pros:
Salary is competitive
Benefits are unique to market
Lots of excellent soft skill training 
Regular Formal and scheduled management collaboration sessions
cons:
The executive management run an old boys club mentality. There is lots of talk of diversity and inclusion but the tone is not set from the top. 
Workplace bullying is prominent from a select few and is allowed and tolerated at the expense of frustrating and losing great talent.
Employees are often forced into positions that they may not want.
No formal or informal mentoring program for new hires or recent promotions.

headline: Consultant
pros: Professional environment to work, positive people to with.
cons: Since the bank is located overseas the hours are different than in the State.

headline: Great if you know the right people
pros: Opportunity for advancement & access to senior management
cons: Biased HR, high turnover, inconsistent performance reviews

headline: The bank of last resort!
pros: Nothing whatsoever absolutely awful place to work!
cons: Everything, the worst place I have ever worked, what a big mistake even being associated with this place, dare I say it's just corrupt!

headline: Forced to review
pros: Family oriented, Owner was super awesome and really loves his staff
cons: Worked hard, clique(y) atmosphere, Some of the senior staff were a little odd

headline: Cutting Edge Technology and ready for economy to rebound and take advantage of it's enablement
pros: Challenging environment, room to grow, learning environment and great family atmosphere.
cons:
As with many companies their are those interested in 'I' and not the team and need to maneuver around them.
Tough economy to generate fee's and thus profits are down.
